questions.question: 1. Identify the correct order in which the nodes are specified in SPICE for a mosfet

explanations.a: Incorrect. This is not the correct order for MOSFET node specification in SPICE.
explanations.b: Correct. SPICE specifies MOSFET nodes as Drain, Gate, Source, Bulkterminal.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is not the correct order for MOSFET node specification in SPICE.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There is a correct option for MOSFET node order.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following is not a part of the SPICE input file?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Data statements are part of the SPICE input file.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Control statements are part of the SPICE input file.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Output statements are part of the SPICE input file.
explanations.d: Correct. There is no specific 'behavioral statement' category in SPICE.

questions.question: 3. What does this indicate .DC Vds 0 5 0.5 Vgs 0 5 1?

answers.a: The voltage Vds will be swept from 0 to 5V in steps of 1V for every value of Vgs.
answers.b: The voltage Vgs will be swept from 0 to 5V in steps of 1V for every value of Vds. ()
answers.c: The voltage Vds will be swept from 0 to 1V in steps of 5V for every value of Vgs.

explanations.a: Correct. Vds is swept from 0 to 5V in steps of 0.5V for each value of Vgs.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Vgs is not swept for every value of Vds in this statement.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The step size is not greater than the maximum voltage in this case.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There is a correct option above.

questions.question: 4. What are the analysis done to obtain the graphs for the experiments done so far?

explanations.a: Incorrect. DC analysis alone does not provide all required graphs; transient analysis is also needed.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Transient analysis alone does not provide all required graphs; DC analysis is also needed.
explanations.c: Correct. Both DC and transient analysis are used to obtain the graphs for these experiments.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There are correct options above.

questions.question: 5. Which statement is false about declaration of capacitor in SPICE

answers.a: The positive node is followed by the negative node in declsration
answers.b: There is no way to specify intial condition

explanations.a: Incorrect. The positive node is not always followed by the negative node in SPICE declaration.
explanations.b: Correct. SPICE allows specification of initial conditions for capacitors using the .IC statement.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Both statements above are not true together.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There is a correct option above.

questions.question: 6. Among the following which of the analysis can neither be printed nor plotted

explanations.a: Incorrect. DC analysis can be printed or plotted.
explanations.b: Correct. Noise analysis cannot be printed or plotted directly; it provides statistical results.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Transient analysis can be printed or plotted.
explanations.d: Incorrect. AC analysis can be printed or plotted.

questions.question: 7. The file extension which is not generated by spice?

explanations.a: Incorrect. .tr0 is a file extension generated by SPICE.
explanations.b: Incorrect. .st0 is a file extension generated by SPICE.
explanations.c: Incorrect. .ic is a file extension generated by SPICE.
explanations.d: Correct. All listed extensions can be generated by SPICE.

questions.question: 8. What analysis should be performed to study variation of voltage over time?

explanations.a: Incorrect. .op analysis does not study voltage variation over time.
explanations.b: Correct. .tran analysis is used to study voltage variation over time.
explanations.c: Incorrect. .dc analysis does not study voltage variation over time.
explanations.d: Incorrect. .sens analysis does not study voltage variation over time.

questions.question: 9. Which of the following statement is false?

answers.a: First statement of a spice code is a comment

explanations.a: Correct. The first statement in a SPICE code is typically a comment.
explanations.b: Correct. Comments in SPICE begin with an asterisk (*).
explanations.c: Incorrect. Comments in SPICE do not begin with #.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There is a false statement above.

questions.question: 10. What is the PC version of spice called?

explanations.a: Incorrect. HSPICE is not the PC version of SPICE.
explanations.b: Correct. PSPICE is the PC version of SPICE.
explanations.c: Incorrect. TSPICE is not the PC version of SPICE.
explanations.d: Incorrect. NSPICE is not the PC version of SPICE.
